```{r echo=FALSE, fig.align='center', fig.height=10, fig.width=15, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, paged.print=FALSE}
options(scipen = 999)
today = "https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1oN1RUGHosHNrIWvwYyO4fyDfAKBuYPyvmCWZPJJmgm8/edit#gid=1404133649"
today = gsheet2tbl(today)

Active<-today$No[1]
Death<-today$No[3]
recovered<-today$No[2]

Active_p<-round((today$No[1] / sum(today$No))*100, 2)
Death_p<-round((today$No[3] / sum(today$No))*100, 2)
recovered_p<-round((today$No[2] / sum(today$No))*100, 2)
```

# Age and Gender covid Death percentage
```{r echo=FALSE, fig.align='center', fig.height=10, fig.width=15, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, paged.print=FALSE}
library(ggthemes)

da = "https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1oN1RUGHosHNrIWvwYyO4fyDfAKBuYPyvmCWZPJJmgm8/edit#gid=85827545"
da = gsheet2tbl(da)

da$Age<-factor(da$Age)

dag<-ggplot(da,aes(reorder(Age,-Percentage),Percentage,label = paste0(round(Percentage,digits = 0),"%"),fill=Percentage))+
  geom_bar(position = "dodge",stat = "identity")+
  geom_text(size = 5,position = position_stack(vjust = 0.5))
dag+scale_fill_gradient(low = "skyblue",
                        high = "#d84315")+xlab("Age")+ylab("")+theme_minimal(base_size = 20)+theme(legend.position = "none")+scale_y_continuous(labels = function(x) paste0(x, "%"))+
  ggtitle("COVID-19 Mortality Rates Across Various Age Groups",subtitle = "Data Source: https://old.dghs.gov.bd")


dm = "https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1oN1RUGHosHNrIWvwYyO4fyDfAKBuYPyvmCWZPJJmgm8/edit#gid=2139410096"
dm = gsheet2tbl(dm)

dm$Gender<-factor(dm$Gender)

pie = ggplot(dm, aes(x = 2, y = Percentage,label = paste0(round(Percentage,digits = 0),"%"),fill = Gender)) +
    geom_bar(stat = "identity") +
    coord_polar(theta = "y", start = 0) + geom_text(size = 8, position = position_stack(vjust = 0.5))+
    theme_void() +
    theme(legend.title = element_text(size = 15),
          legend.text = element_text(size = 15)) +
    labs(fill = "Gender") +
    xlim(0.5, 2.5)
pie<-pie+scale_fill_tableau()+ggtitle("Gender")+ geom_col(width = 7, col = "white")+theme(plot.title = element_text(color="black", size=14, face="bold"))
pie
```

# Vaccine Situation in Bangladesh
```{r echo=FALSE, fig.align='center', fig.height=20, fig.width=15, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, paged.print=FALSE}

topdw= "https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1oN1RUGHosHNrIWvwYyO4fyDfAKBuYPyvmCWZPJJmgm8/edit#gid=1316354113"
topdw = gsheet2tbl(topdw)

dose<-topdw[1:11,]

dose1<-dose%>%
  select('District',`1st Dose`,`Parcentage of 1st Dose`,`2nd Dose`,`Parcentage of 2nd Dose`)

dose1<-dose1%>%
  group_by(District) %>%
  gather(Variable, Value,`Parcentage of 1st Dose`,`Parcentage of 2nd Dose`,`1st Dose`,`2nd Dose`, factor_key = TRUE)


doseg<-ggplot(dose1,aes(reorder(District,-Value),Value,label = Value,fill=Variable))+
  geom_bar(position = "stack",stat = "identity")+
  geom_text(size = 5,position = position_stack(vjust = 0.5))+facet_wrap(~Variable)
doseg+coord_flip()+scale_fill_calc()+ggtitle("COVID-19 vaccination in Bangladesh's top districts",subtitle = "Data Source: dghs.gov.bd")+labs(caption = "Created by: Md. Mahdi Hasan")+
  theme_minimal(base_size = 20)+theme(legend.position = "none",axis.text.x = element_blank())+
  xlab("Districts")
 
 mnnm1<-dose[1,]
 
mnnma1<-mnnm1$District
mnnmb1<-mnnm1$Population
mnnmc1<-mnnm1$`1st Dose`
mnnmd1<-mnnm1$`2nd Dose`
mnnme1<-mnnm1$`Parcentage of 1st Dose`
mnnmf1<-mnnm1$`Parcentage of 2nd Dose`
```

**Comment**:
From the above plot wee see that, the highest population among the 64 districts is `r mnnma1`, the **Total Population**, **1st dose**, and **2nd dose**, **Parcentage of 1st dose** and **Parcentage of 2nd dose** are $`r mnnmb1`$, $`r mnnmc1`$, $`r mnnmd1`$, $`r mnnme1`\%$ and $`r mnnmf1`\%$

# Vaccine total Situation
```{r echo=FALSE, fig.align='center', fig.height=15, fig.width=15, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, paged.print=FALSE}
options(scipen = 999)

Situation <- paste("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/owid/covid-19-data/master/public/data/vaccinations/country_data/Bangladesh.csv", sep = "")
Situation <- read_csv(Situation)

# Create dummy variables for each type of vaccine
Situation <- Situation %>%
  mutate(
    Oxford_AstraZeneca = factor(ifelse(grepl("Oxford/AstraZeneca", vaccine), "Yes", "No")),
    Sinopharm_Beijing = factor(ifelse(grepl("Sinopharm/Beijing", vaccine), "Yes", "No")),
    Pfizer_BioNTech = factor(ifelse(grepl("Pfizer/BioNTech", vaccine), "Yes", "No")),
    Johnson_Johnson = factor(ifelse(grepl("Johnson&Johnson", vaccine), "Yes", "No")),
    Moderna = factor(ifelse(grepl("Moderna", vaccine), "Yes", "No")),
    Sinovac = factor(ifelse(grepl("Sinovac", vaccine), "Yes", "No"))
  )

Situation$date<-as.Date(Situation$date,"%d/%m/%Y")



Oxford<-Situation%>%
  group_by(Oxford_AstraZeneca)%>%
  summarise(freq = n())

Oxford<-Oxford%>%
  mutate(Relative_Frequency = (freq/sum(freq))*100)%>%
  arrange(desc(Relative_Frequency))
Oxford<-Oxford%>%
  filter(Oxford!= "NA" & Oxford!= "No")


levels(Oxford$Oxford_AstraZeneca)[levels(Oxford$Oxford_AstraZeneca)=="Yes"] <-"Oxford/AstraZeneca"

Sinopharm_Beijing<-Situation%>%
  group_by(Sinopharm_Beijing)%>%
  summarise(freq = n())

Sinopharm_Beijing<-Sinopharm_Beijing%>%
  mutate(Relative_Frequency = (freq/sum(freq))*100)%>%
  arrange(desc(Relative_Frequency))
Sinopharm_Beijing<-Sinopharm_Beijing%>%
  filter(Sinopharm_Beijing!= "NA" & Sinopharm_Beijing!= "No")


levels(Sinopharm_Beijing$Sinopharm_Beijing)[levels(Sinopharm_Beijing$Sinopharm_Beijing)=="Yes"] <-"Sinopharm/Beijing"


Pfizer_BioNTech<-Situation%>%
  group_by(Pfizer_BioNTech)%>%
  summarise(freq = n())

Pfizer_BioNTech<-Pfizer_BioNTech%>%
  mutate(Relative_Frequency = (freq/sum(freq))*100)%>%
  arrange(desc(Relative_Frequency))
Pfizer_BioNTech<-Pfizer_BioNTech%>%
  filter(Pfizer_BioNTech!= "NA" & Pfizer_BioNTech!= "No")


levels(Pfizer_BioNTech$Pfizer_BioNTech)[levels(Pfizer_BioNTech$Pfizer_BioNTech)=="Yes"] <-"Pfizer/BioNTech"


Moderna<-Situation%>%
  group_by(Moderna)%>%
  summarise(freq = n())

Moderna<-Moderna%>%
  mutate(Relative_Frequency = (freq/sum(freq))*100)%>%
  arrange(desc(Relative_Frequency))
Moderna<-Moderna%>%
  filter(Moderna!= "NA" & Moderna!= "No")


levels(Moderna$Moderna)[levels(Moderna$Moderna)=="Yes"] <-"Moderna"

Johnson_Johnson<-Situation%>%
  group_by(Johnson_Johnson)%>%
  summarise(freq = n())

Johnson_Johnson<-Johnson_Johnson%>%
  mutate(Relative_Frequency = (freq/sum(freq))*100)%>%
  arrange(desc(Relative_Frequency))
Johnson_Johnson<-Johnson_Johnson%>%
  filter(Johnson_Johnson!= "NA" & Johnson_Johnson!= "No")


levels(Johnson_Johnson$Johnson_Johnson)[levels(Johnson_Johnson$Johnson_Johnson)=="Yes"] <-"Johnson_Johnson"


Sinovac<-Situation%>%
  group_by(Sinovac)%>%
  summarise(freq = n())

Sinovac<-Sinovac%>%
  mutate(Relative_Frequency = (freq/sum(freq))*100)%>%
  arrange(desc(Relative_Frequency))
Sinovac<-Sinovac%>%
  filter(Sinovac!= "NA" & Sinovac!= "No")


levels(Sinovac$Sinovac)[levels(Sinovac$Sinovac)=="Yes"] <-"Sinovac"


names(Oxford)<-c("Vaccines","Frequency","Percentage")
names(Sinopharm_Beijing)<-c("Vaccines","Frequency","Percentage")
names(Pfizer_BioNTech)<-c("Vaccines","Frequency","Percentage")
names(Moderna)<-c("Vaccines","Frequency","Percentage")
names(Johnson_Johnson)<-c("Vaccines","Frequency","Percentage")
names(Sinovac)<-c("Vaccines","Frequency","Percentage")

m2<-rbind(Oxford,Sinopharm_Beijing,Pfizer_BioNTech,Moderna,Johnson_Johnson,Sinovac)

m2<-m2%>%
  arrange(desc(Percentage))

knitr::kable(m2,caption = "Vaccine company")

m2g <- ggplot(m2, aes(reorder(Vaccines, Frequency), Frequency, label = paste0(round(Frequency, digits = 0)), fill = Frequency)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity") +
  geom_text(size = 8, position = position_stack(vjust = 0.5)) +
  xlab("Vaccine Name") +
  ylab("Number") +
  theme_minimal(base_size = 20) +
  theme(legend.position = "none") +
  coord_flip() +
  ggtitle("Vaccine Company")+scale_fill_gradient2_tableau()

m2g
```
